name: Tasks Multi-Select
description: Add multi-select capability to the Tasks page for bulk status updates, assignment, and deletion.

tasks.description: Define scope and requirements for multi-select feature.
subtasks: Analyzed current tasks.js and AG Grid implementation
Defined in-scope bulk actions (Status, Priority, Owner, Delete)
Wrote detailed user stories and acceptance criteria
Added Interaction States Checklist for bulk UI
Created pipeline plan including Andrei and Robert
decisions: Excluded bulk editing of text fields (title/desc) to keep scope manageable
Decided on a floating Bulk Action Bar instead of replacing the filter bar to allow context maintenance
Requires confirmation dialog for bulk delete only

tasks.description: Define implementation approach for AG Grid selection and bulk actions.
subtasks: Analyzed existing saveProjectTasks logic and AG Grid config
Designed 'Optimistic UI' pattern for bulk updates
Defined data flow for grouping updates by project ID
Specified new AG Grid column config for checkboxes
decisions: Use AG Grid native selection state as source of truth
Implement optimistic UI updates before API calls for responsiveness
Use Promise.allSettled for parallel cross-project saves
Bypass existing debounce for bulk actions to ensure execution

tasks.description: Design the bulk action bar and selection states.
subtasks: Defined floating 'pill' layout for desktop and fixed bottom sheet for mobile
Specified high-contrast dark theme (neutral-900) to distinguish from light grid
detailed CSS specs for bar, inputs, and buttons using design tokens
Defined interaction states (hover, focus, disabled) and entrance/exit animations
Ensured accessibility (contrast, keyboard nav) and responsiveness
decisions: Chose a floating pill design for the action bar to keep it distinct from the grid
Used dark theme (neutral-900) for high contrast against the light page
Defined mobile behavior as a fixed bottom sheet

tasks.description: Implement multi-select and bulk actions in tasks.js.
Verify bulk actions work correctly across projects.
